text: Location map of Noćaj and northern part of the Mačva region Serbian Orthodox church Noćaj (; pronounced ) is a village in northern Serbia. It is located in the Sremska Mitrovica municipality, in the Syrmia District, Vojvodina province. Geographically, it is situated in the Mačva region. The population of Noćaj is 1,866 people (according to the 2011 census), and most of its inhabitants are ethnic Serbs. ==Geography== Geographically, the settlement is located in the northern part of Macva, while administratively it belongs to the Autonomous province of Vojvodina. The Zasavica (bog) partly belongs to the area of Noćaj. This reserve is a wetland area with floodplain meadows and forests of 1825 hectares, today known for beavers. The area of northern Macva is of a plain-swampy character, suitable for field and vegetable growing. It is directly connected to the European route E70 via the State road 20, to the north, while it is connected to the Badovinci border crossing to the south. ==Demographics== {| class="wikitable" |+Historical populationДефинитивни резултати пописа становништва од 31. марта 1931. године, књига 1.
